If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**  9.2.59-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72923
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ag131125@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team


## Action Performed:
Precondition: Use an Expensifail account with no bank account previously set
1. Launch the Expensify app
2. Create a workspace
3. Change the currency to USD if needed
4. Enable Expensify Card
5. Go to the Expensify Card tab > Issue new card
6. Tap on Log into your bank
7. Go through the Plaid flow until you reach the "What's your legal name? screen
8. Enter the following data:
First name: Alberta
Last name: Charleson
9. Tap on Next
10. Tap several times on the back arrow at the top left until you reach the "Add bank account" screen
11. Tap on Continue setup > Confirm

## Expected Result:
The "What's your date of birth?" is displayed

## Actual Result:
The "Manually add your bank account" setup screen is displayed

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] Expose some basic data in the JS console when not running in production

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem When trying to debug issues, reporting the IDs of the relevant objects (policy, report, transaction, etc) is key, so we can inspect the DB, gather logs, etc That data is not currently easily accessible, so it's hard for internal employees as well as contributors to report issues with all the necessary data so that we can investigate them. # Solution When NOT in production (see `isProductionLib` and a similar use case [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9970ee0d37b149233a8c53c6d8ab031a282d672e/src/setup/addUtilsToWindow.ts#L15)), we want to expose to the JS console certain variables: - When in the workspace editor: the `policy` object in the variable `policy` - When in a report: the `report` object in the variable `report`, the `policy` it belongs to in the `policy` variable - When in a one expense report or in the transaction view: the `transaction` object in the variable `transaction`, the `receipt` object in the `receipt` variable (only if transaction has a receipt), the `report` object in the `report` variable and the policy it belongs to in the `policy` variable

  • Upwork Job ID: 1990458971781193172
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-11-17
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @eh2077

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.59-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1995/folder/13176707/46331221/1016710652 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1 l@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Create a workspace 3. Enable rules 4. Tap Rules - Enable Prevent self approval 5. Tap workflow - Disable all features 6. Tap Rules - Note Prevent self approval is locked and disabled 7. Open workspace chat 8. Create an expense 9. Open the expense 10. Note the header message ## Expected Result: Prevent self approval is locked so expense header must not display oops! Looks like submitting yourself. ## Actual Result: Prevent self approval is locked but expense header displays oops! Looks like submitting yourself. Note : After disabling the workflow, it doesn’t turn off Prevent Self Approval in OD. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e83eccee-9f4c-48b3-b6bd-34f1edbc4d1f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.59-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1995/folder/13176670/41237102/1016710066 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1 l@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Go to workspace settings 3. Enable invoice feature 4. Disable all workflow features 5. Send an invoice 6. Long press invoice created 7. Note Delete option is not shown 8. Open the invoice - More - Delete 9. Note deleting invoice shows unexpected error ## Expected Result: When workflows are disabled, deleting invoice must not show unexpected error. body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.59-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y (Able to reproduce the Rules disabled issue) **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Tmjarnesk1 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1763148123030259) ## Action Performed: 1. In Classic, enable: Workspace → Expenses → Cash expenses are reimbursable by default 2. Create a cash expense in Classic 3. Submit the report 4. As an admin, open the submitted expenses 5. Observe that each expense is not marked as reimbursable 6. Open the workspace in NewDot: 7. Go to Workspace Settings → Rules ## Expected Result: Cash expenses should automatically be marked reimbursable based on the Classic setting. Rules in enabled status ## Actual Result: Cash expenses arrive not reimbursable. Admin must manually check the reimbursable box for every expense. In NewDot, the Rules is disabled in workspace settings and does not match Classic. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Open app login with account have some reports 2. Tap on Reports tab 3. Tap on "Filters" button 4. Select any option (can select option with no result) 5. Tap Save 6. Tap Save search 7. Tap on the menu next to search box 8. Scroll down to Saved section 9. Tap on three dot of the saved search and delete 10. Tap on arrow of Type: Expense, Status, Date, From ## Expected Result: App should respond when tap on Type: Expense, Status, Date, From ## Actual Result: App doesn't respond when tap on Type: Expense, Status, Date, From ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1d4c9807-28a7-4862-8207-0c27a285d95d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.59-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176676/test-cases/41237298 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sintayewhaylu01@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensfy.com 2. Create an expense in Workspace chat 3. Open the expense details and add multiple comments (20 or more) 4. Scroll up and submit the expense 4, Retract the expense 6. Change the category or tag 7. Navigate away from the expense, then return to it ## Expected Result: Updating the category or tag should not cause the bottom comments to briefly appear ## Actual Result: In Steps 6 and 7, the bottom comments briefly appear whenever opening the expense detail page or updating the category or tag ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.59-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71675 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ck111425@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Workspace chat -> Create a distance expense (call ExpenseWS) 3. Go to Self DM -> Create a distance expense (call ExpenseDM) 4. Open distance expense in self DM 5. Go offline 6. Tap More button >> Merge option >> select the displayed distance expense >> tap Continue 7. Select the merchant details of workspace distance expense (ExpenseWS) 8. Tap on Merge expenses 9. Observe skeleton loading displayed 10. Select the workspace distance expense in LHN 11. Observe empty report displayed ## Expected Result: No skeleton loader displayed when merging self DM distance expense with WS distance expense in offline mode & also expense preview should be displayed workspace chat instead of empty report ## Actual Result: 1. Skeleton loader when merging self DM distance expense with WS distance expense in offline mode 2. Empty report displayed in workspace chat ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$125] Migrate icons expensify branding - sign in icons - empty states & special to lazy loading

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Background We're migrating all icons and illustrations to use lazy loading to improve app startup performance by reducing the main bundle size. This is part of a larger initiative tracked in #74599. ### What needs to be done Migrate the following icons and illustrations to use the lazy loading system: **Icons/Illustrations to migrate:** **Expensify Branding:** - `ExpensifyAppIcon` - `ExpensifyCard` - `ExpensifyFooterLogo` - `ExpensifyFooterLogoVertical` - `ExpensifyLogoNew` - `ExpensifyWordmark` **Sign In Icons:** - `AppleLogo` - `GoogleLogo` **Empty States & Special:** - `EmptyStateRoutePending` - `EmptyStateSpyPigeon` - `MessageInABottle` - `ReceiptBody` - `SmartScan` - `TreasureChest` - `Exit` ### Migration Guide Please follow the comprehensive migration guide here: https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/contributingGuides/LAZY_ICONS_AND_ILLUSTRATIONS.md
